intro: Uvaria ambongoensis var. sciocarpa, commonly known as the black uvaria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly the Democratic Republic of the Congo. The plant is characterized by its dark, almost black fruits that are highly valued in traditional medicine. Its leaves are typically ovate and glossy, while the flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. The botanical significance of this variant lies in its unique morphological features and its role in local ecological and medicinal systems.
